proposals.title: Math Made Easy!
proposals.shortDescription: I have the wonderful opportunity to help include students with disabilities in regular classrooms. Because my students are a part of a regular classroom for all parts of the day, they must...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need math manipulatives and organization tools to help them learn their basic math facts.
proposals.synopsis: I have the wonderful opportunity to help include students with disabilities in regular classrooms.  Because my students are a part of a regular classroom for all parts of the day, they must participate in all aspects of the classroom which includes the challenging grade level standards. <br/><br/>I have 17 students in 2 regular education 4th grade classrooms.  We are a Title 1 school, in an economically disadvantaged area of south Georgia and 100% of the students at our school receive free breakfast and lunch each day.  My students' disabilities include learning disabilities in reading, writing and math, ADHD, behavior/emotional disorders and Asperger Syndrome. They are very hard workers and want to be a part of a regular classroom. <br/><br/>My students have been very successful in the regular classrooms despite the academic deficits they have.  We often work in small groups to address their individual needs and teach them skills to be able to be successful in the regular classroom. Because they have math and reading deficits their disabilities can have a negative impact on their performance throughout their academic day. It is important for my students to have creative opportunities to learn their basic math facts so that when they are taught grade level skills, they are not hindered by basic math facts. I have a new strategy to help the students learn their facts but it requires some supplies that we do not have at my school. <br/><br/>The manipulatives and supplies provided through this grant will give students with disabilities another way to learn their basic math facts by using hands on activities. Often times, it just takes teaching a skill in a little different way for it to click with my students with disabilities.

proposals.title: More Leveled Readers Please!
proposals.shortDescription: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better. It's not. - Dr. Seuss<br /><br />Learning to read is an amazing time in a child's life. My students are eager to read...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need books to read that are at their instructional level and bin to store them in.
proposals.synopsis:
"Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better.  It's not.  - Dr. Seuss

Learning to read is an amazing time in a child's life. My students are eager to read everything. It can be frustrating though when they don't have access to books at their levels. <br/><br/>We are a small school district that borders Detroit. We have a large population of students that are living in poverty with 100% of our students eligible for free breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I teach in a special education resource room for students in grades K-3. Most of my students are reading significantly below grade level. This affects their ability to be successful in all academic areas. <br/><br/>I have started incorporating The Daily 5 into my daily literacy block. The Daily 5 provides literacy structure that allows for differentiation in the classroom. One of the choices is read to self. It is the foundation for creating independent readers. It is important for students to find " Good Fit Books". This is a book that the reader enjoys, which can be read with accuracy, fluency and comprehension. Although I have many books in my room, they are not all "Good Fit Books". 

I was fortunate to have a project funded that allowed me to get level C and level F books for my classroom.  This is a nice start, but I have students at many different levels.  I need to add a variety of levels to reach more readers.  My students will use these new level H and level K books independently or will read with a partner while I am providing small group instruction. I am asking for a book box to hold the books. I will use the More Read and Understand book during my small group instruction. <br/><br/>By donating to my project  you will be helping to build a leveled library. My students will improve their reading fluency by having "Good Fit Books" to read. These books will provide my students with the opportunity to become strong and confident readers.

proposals.title: Supplies To Get Us Through The Rest Of The Year!
proposals.shortDescription: When teaching students with disabilities, it becomes necessary to develop different ways to let them show that they understand the concepts being taught. Differentiating instruction and teaching...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need paint, paint brushes, markers, poster board, glitter, and more to help them express their understanding of concepts taught.
proposals.synopsis:
When teaching students with disabilities, it becomes necessary to develop different ways to let them show that they understand the concepts being taught. Differentiating instruction and teaching to their learning styles helps them understand the concepts being taught.  <br/><br/>My students are eleventh and twelfth graders with disabilities. They are classified as emotionally disturbed.   I currently teach these students English, United States History, and United States Government.   My students have faced numerous obstacles in their lives and it is a major accomplishment that they still come to school on a daily basis.  My lovely bunch continues to impress me day after day as I watch them rise to every challenge that I put before them.  

I have to constantly be creative and think outside of the box for ways to engage my students in activities.  By making lessons creative, I can hook my students into learning and actually get them to enjoy the learning process.  My students constantly give me their all on a day to day basis and it is my duty to try to get them all of the resources possible to help them succeed. <br/><br/>I can always find a student that is drawing at every possible opportunity. In general my students really enjoy art. My students need paint, paint brushes, markers, poster board, glitter, and more so that they can express their creativity. These supplies will help me continue to be creative with my students.  The supplies will give my students another method to express their understanding of concepts. The supplies will also allow them to express their creative and artistic skills.   <br/><br/>These supplies will make a huge difference in my classroom.  They will give my students that like to draw another way to show that they understand the concepts being taught in class.  By giving my students an additional way to express themselves, they will be more likely to remember key concepts in the course. This learning can then be shared by students with their classmates to help deepen the learning for everyone.

proposals.title: Just Right Books For Reluctant Readers!
proposals.shortDescription: Reading can be an awesome adventure, or a frustrating task. My students are struggling readers whose frustration of not being able to read easily hinders their love for literature. I want to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need engaging leveled books!
proposals.synopsis: Reading can be an awesome adventure, or a frustrating task. My students are struggling readers whose frustration of not being able to read easily hinders their love for literature. I want to change that, but I need your help.  <br/><br/>I am a special education teacher with 19 students all with reading disabilities, language impairments, autism, or a mixture of all three. It breaks my heart everyday to hear my students groan and see their eyes roll in disgust when it is time to start reading for the day. They try so hard but are often left to read books that are not age appropriate or engaging because of their lower reading levels. I just wish that my students could fall in love with books like I did when I was their age. I try to make my lessons as fun and engaging as possible but without the right books, little can motivate these reluctant readers to perform.  <br/><br/>With your help, I would love to provide my students with age-appropriate, motivating, and engaging fiction and non-fiction books that are tailored to their unique reading levels. If the students are given the books that they will enjoy, I know I can help them to see how amazing reading can really be. This will lead them to reading more and increasing their reading levels to hopefully read and comprehend grade-level text with ease. The titles that your donations would provide will give my students the opportunity to learn and grow while reading books that they will love. Better readers start with better books!  <br/><br/>These books are just the beginning of creating life-long readers. Nothing would make me happier than seeing my students get excited to come to the guided reading table everyday. Exposing my students to awesome literature written at their reading level will motivate them to explore similar titles are their own; creating independent readers with a love of literature. After all, it all starts with the right book!

proposals.title: Tool for Prader Willis Syndrome Child
proposals.shortDescription: Entering my classroom is like entering a judgment free zone. Everyone helps one another, encourages one another and strives to do their very best, as a team. 21 second graders grow their minds,...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an iPad, so that everyone can communicate and learn together.
proposals.synopsis:
Entering my classroom is like entering a judgment free zone.  Everyone helps one another, encourages one another and strives to do their very best, as a team.  <br/><br/>21 second graders grow their minds, bodies and souls, within our inner city classroom.  The students beg to remain in the classroom at the end of the school day. Obviously, they love learning and care for each other a lot. We have 4 English Language Learners, 3 students with severe ADHD and 1 boy with many special needs. He has been diagnosed with Prader Willis Syndrome, Autism, Mutism and Narcolepsy and has a paraprofessional supporting him with daily activities. 

All students at our school recieve free breakfast and lunch due to the high poverty rate in the community. Our school also provides many with hats, gloves, and jackets during the cold winter months.  <br/><br/>All students in my class will be able to benefit from this technology.
Mutism can be overcome with the help of the iPad. This young boy will have a voice for the first time in his life, by using a free app! His mind can be stimulated with the colorful and interactive apps, which research has proven to assist autistic students. This stimulation can help keep him awake in class! The ipad mini will make turning the pages of a book easier for his poor fine motor skills to handle! (Sorry, I get a bit hopeful when I talk about iPads and this boy.)
Research shows that part of the reason why inner city students score lower than their suburban peers is because they are not familiar with the technology, which is being used to evaluate them. Never mind the fact that students are almost expected to enter their career with knowledge of technology. 

Students will all also use the IXL app amoung others.  <br/><br/>Plain and simple, the iPad will change our lives forever. A voice will be given to a child who so desperately deserves it. Students will grow together with the help of this technology that others take for granted. Thank you! :)

proposals.title: Tell Me, and I'll Forget. Show Me, and I'll Remember.
proposals.shortDescription: For students with disabilities and English language learners, school can be profoundly frustrating and overwhelming. Too many do not even finish high school. Text and lecture supported by visual...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an LCD Projector and Document camera to support their unique needs as special education students and English language learners.
proposals.synopsis:
For students with disabilities and English language learners, school can be profoundly frustrating and overwhelming. Too many do not even finish high school. Text and lecture supported by visual aids, video, and interactive programs help them process material that would otherwise be inaccessible. <br/><br/>My students are Special Education students and English language learners in a Chicago neighborhood school that serves a high-poverty population. They are an extremely diverse group of learners, and represent many different races, religions, languages, and socio-economic and cultural backgrounds. 
My school serves many immigrant families from around the world, and often my students enter high school with interruptions in schooling due to homelessness, transience, and lack of access to education in their home countries. Most of my students enter school with literacy and math skills significantly below grade level, in addition to the challenges of language barriers and disabilities. 
For my students, math and science classes are often inaccessible and overwhelming, due to the technical language used, cumulative skills required, and complex processing skills needed to master new content and skills. <br/><br/>With a document camera and LCD projector dedicated exclusively to meeting the needs of special education students and ELLs, I could provide much needed support and supplemental instruction in the form of visual aids, video, interactive simulations, and online activities both in my inclusion classrooms and through individual/small group instruction. 

Using a document camera would enable me to model critical skills like note-taking, annotation, and problem solving in a multi-modal way that engages students' multiple intelligences and shows them in real time exactly what they need to do to be successful. Since many of my students have deficits in auditory processing, visual input is essential to remembering and understanding instructions and classroom tasks. 

Using this technology with small groups during pull-out instruction would enable me to maximize the efficiency of precious instructional time, and help them keep pace with their classmates in general education courses. <br/><br/>Your support helps ensure equity and access in education for Chicago's most vulnerable populations. Research consistently shows that students who interact with content in varied and multi-modal ways develop skills more quickly, perform better academically, demonstrate higher self-confidence, and are more motivated and engaged in their educations.

Please help bridge the achievement gap for students with special learning needs by giving them access to this powerful and much- needed technology.

proposals.title: Non-Verbal Autistic Students Need Z-Vibe
proposals.shortDescription: My students are Non-Verbal and are constantly struggling with communication. They deserve the appropriate tools needed to help facilitate speech, despite them attending school in a high-poverty,...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a Z-Vibe tool for oral-motor stimulation and sensory input.
proposals.synopsis: My students are Non-Verbal and are constantly struggling with communication. They deserve the appropriate tools needed to help facilitate speech, despite them attending school in a high-poverty, high-crime neighborhood. <br/><br/>My students are five and six year old non-verbal students who enjoy learning and exploring.  They attend an offsite school that receives very little to no supplies, let alone speech tools such as Z-Vibes, that can improve my students' speech.  I am requesting 2 Z-Vibes to access ways to help my students communicate and learn. The Z-Vibes will truly be an irreplaceable speech tool in my classroom. <br/><br/>The Z-Vibe is a vibrating tool for oral-motor stimulation and sensory input. The Z-Vibe provides gentle vibrations that are great for stimulating the gums, palate, tongue, mouth, cheeks and lips.  The z vibe is great for strengthening oral awareness and motor function.  This tool will benefit my students in many areas, including: articulation, auditory discrimination and language stimulation. <br/><br/>By donating to this project you will be giving a child a voice.  Not only do Z-Vibes facilitate their learning, but it reinforces skills that are critical for students on the spectrum. Every dollar is one step closer to positively impacting not only my students, but future students that follow.

proposals.title: Let there be Light!
proposals.shortDescription: True expression is the key to success. My students are in need of a place where they can tell their story and where they will be heard. Coming from neighborhoods with minimal opportunity, my...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need three light boxes for drawing class and Velcro to adhere final drawings to matte board.
proposals.synopsis:
True expression is the key to success. My students are in need of a place where they can tell their story and where they will be heard. Coming from neighborhoods with minimal opportunity, my students use the resources of the Talent/Art Class as a place to safely express themselves.
 <br/><br/>The majority of my students are English Language Learners and Special Needs students. They are struggling financially and come from neighborhoods full of crime and gang activity. They are high school students and they are preparing themselves to enter the world as young adults. Our school is a safe zone, full of caring individuals who treat our student body as family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of funding, our ability to purchase materials has been cut tremendously. Many of my students would like to pursue higher education or obtain a career in a field relating to the arts. These materials would allow the students to improve their art-making techniques while expanding their portfolios.  <br/><br/>Having light boxes in the classroom will allow students two practice art making techniques. They will be able to reference major works of art and use the light box to copy those techniques of art making while developing their own personal style. Many of my students love cartooning and the light box will allow them to create characters in a step by step process. Many of my students have desires to apply to major universities and schools. Good materials to create their artwork is crucial for a quality portfolio, in which colleges and jobs will look. Students also have more confidence and self-esteem when they know they are using and trusted with materials that will ensure their success.  <br/><br/>These materials will have both an immediate impact as well as a long term impact. The light boxes and markers will allow students this year to be independent, innovative and creative with their art making. These materials will last for years to come, ensuring that the students of future classes will have quality art materials to ensure success in their futures.

proposals.title: Whisper Reading To Success!
proposals.shortDescription: "Can I use a whisper phone?" This is something many of students ask, but unfortunately after years of use I only have a few whisper phones available. I would love to be able to provide this...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 30 whisper phones to help them improve their reading skills.
proposals.synopsis: "Can I use a whisper phone?"  This is something many of students ask, but unfortunately after years of use I only have a few whisper phones available.  I would love to be able to provide this wonderful tool to every student in my class! <br/><br/>I have the pleasure of teaching wonderful second grade students in Pennsylvania. These children are a true pleasure to teach and remind me daily why I love teaching. They face many challenges on a daily basis, however they always give their all and truly want to learn! <br/><br/>The whisper phones will allow the children to listen to themselves read without being distracted by the other children. This will allow them to truly focus on what they are reading, giving them the opportunity to improve their accuracy and think about what they are reading. This will help them improve their fluency and reading comprehension skills. These whisper phones will be used on a daily basis to help the students improve their fluency and comprehension skills. The students will also use these phones while taking a reading, science, math, or social studies test.<br/><br/>Your donation will give a wonderful group of children the opportunity to improve their reading skills.  You will be providing them with a tool that will help them gain lifelong skills.  Additionally, your donation will make a group of well-deserving children very happy!

proposals.title: Little Ones Would Love a Laminator!
proposals.shortDescription: As an educator, I am always looking for new and lasting ways to keep my students engaged in their learning. One way I think I can accomplish this goal is to have a personal classroom laminator to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a new laminator and laminating pouches to help make manipulatives and learning activities more durable.
proposals.synopsis: As an educator, I am always looking for new and lasting ways to keep my students engaged in their learning. One way I think I can accomplish this goal is to have a personal classroom laminator to laminate small group games, task cards, and student work for display in and out of the classroom. <br/><br/>My students are incredible! I have 8 motivated students eager to learn. My students are diagnosed with a variety of disabilities including: intellectually disabled, speech and language impaired, learning disabled, and autistic.  My students come from a low socioeconomic background with limited resources available. We are a Title 1 school with a 100% free lunch program. Many parents work 2 jobs and are barely able to support the family. I know that if we provide them with the right support, resources, and opportunities, they can experience success. <br/><br/>This laminator and the lamination sheets are going to greatly benefit my students. It will make their materials sturdy and long lasting. This laminator will contribute to all areas of their learning including: math, language arts, science, art and daily living. Their learning materials will be much more sturdy and durable. Throughout the day we go through several manipulative's and when they aren't laminated they just don't last as long. I would also be able to print and laminate student work. <br/><br/>This project is going to greatly help our classroom. Our manipulative's and icons will last much longer. My students will benefit from this laminator across all subjects and it will be in use every day. I think its important for students to see their work on display and preserved for later sharing and memories.

proposals.title: Making Literature Come to Life in Our Special Ed Class!
proposals.shortDescription: It has been said that books open our eyes to the world around us. My students have significant disabilities that create barriers to accessing literature. They need listening center materials so...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 4 CD players, activity centers and books on CDs to create a listening center for literacy time for our special education classroom.
proposals.synopsis:
It has been said that books open our eyes to the world around us. My students have significant disabilities that create barriers to accessing literature. They need listening center materials so they can have their eyes, and ears, opened to the world of reading! <br/><br/>Our school is home to about 300 students in a high poverty, inner city neighborhood. Due to low enrollment and changes within our school district, our school was one step away from being closed last year. Despite the challenges that my students face, they are incredibly resilient. 
The seven students that learn in my classroom all have low incidence disabilities such as Autism Spectrum Disorders and Down Syndrome. Their vivacious personalities, zest for life, desire to learn, and boldness are a huge part of our school culture. They do not let developmental delays or poverty get in the way of their learning. I truly LOVE my job as their teacher and cannot imagine teaching a different group of children. <br/><br/>We are requesting a variety of books on CD so that my students can listen to books and follow along while myself and my classroom assistants work with other children. These books on CD will foster independence within each little learner as they learn how to use the materials and follow the routine by themselves. 
Additionally, we are requesting a listening and following directions activity center. The listening activities on these CDs will help my students to understand concepts such as positional words and "wh" questions about illustrations. 
Of course, none of these materials will be useful without CD players! We also need 4 individual CD players so these materials can be accessed appropriately.  <br/><br/>The materials we are requesting will help my students become more independent, expose them to literature in a new way, and help refine and teach new skills. Please help open the world of reading to my seven deserving learners!

proposals.title: Lights, Camera, Learning!
proposals.shortDescription: Drop the pencil. Put away that worksheet. Today in speech therapy we're producing our own short film. My students have mild to moderate cognitive disabilities and language learning challenges....
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a lighting kit and backdrops (with case) to produce educational videos for peers.
proposals.synopsis: Drop the pencil. Put away that worksheet. Today in speech therapy we're producing our own short film. <br/><br/>My students have mild to moderate cognitive disabilities and language learning challenges. Some are on the autism spectrum. For them, understanding what they hear, finding the right words, and expressing themselves is tough. They're high school students who've seen it all in speech-language therapy... or have they? <br/><br/>Last year, we started a video production group. Together we plan, write, produce, film, and edit short films that demonstrate our learning. We've made vocabulary come to life and created how-to videos for vocational skills. We share these videos with the younger classes and help them learn new skills too. My students have really taken to this experience. Writing and revising isn't a chore when its purpose is to get our script just right. I'm seeing a level of engagement and independence that I've never seen before. I'm also seeing some students set realistic goals to pursue video production as a career after graduation. They're not only acquiring new language; they're learning a marketable skill! We're ready to advance to the next level. We're requesting a lighting kit and backdrops so that our videos can be better quality and so we can learn more about actual video production. <br/><br/>I'm so thrilled by the creativity and innovation demonstrated by my students. I hope you are as excited by this project as we are and that you'll consider helping us accomplish our goals. Thank you for your consideration.

proposals.title: Rap is Poetry
proposals.shortDescription: I have the privilege of teaching a Special Education Behavior Improvement Class (all boys) in a low-income, high minority middle school. My students haven't yet found poetry that speaks to them....
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need to read poetry that is meaningful to them. My students know Tupac as a rapper, and I want them to discover that he was also a poet.
proposals.synopsis: I have the privilege of teaching a Special Education Behavior Improvement Class (all boys) in a low-income, high minority middle school. My students haven't yet found poetry that speaks to them. Tupac writes about the life my students live. His poetry may be the key to unlocking a love of reading. <br/><br/>My students - almost always male - have a variety of issues that make it difficult for them to behave appropriately. Most of them are angry - at themselves and the world - and see no future for themselves beyond a life on the street. Our area is very low income, with almost no jobs available. The students feel like the requirements of school are totally irrelevant to their lives.  They enjoy rap music, and know Tupac Shakur the rapper. I would like to introduce them to Tupac the poet. Tupac writes about events that are familiar to my students, problems they are living with, and challenges they see every day. I hope that if I can reach the students with a book of poetry about their lives, they will see the benefit of reading other things as well. <br/><br/>When I receive these books, I will use them as an introduction to a poetry unit.  We will read Tupac's poems, analyze them, use the poetry to improve our knowledge of figurative language, and write our own poems.  Once the students see that poetry can be relevant and fun to read, we can expand into the more traditional forms of poetry found in standard textbooks. <br/><br/>Your donations will allow my students to see that there are books and poetry written by and for young African-American men.  Once they realize that education is for people like Tupac, and by extension for people like themselves, I will encourage them to continue to explore other types of literature.  They need hope.  Seeing the positive things that have been accomplished by a rapper may be just the thing to give them that hope for a better future.

proposals.title: Today A Reader, Tomorrow A Leader!
proposals.shortDescription: "Readers of good books, particularly books of biography and history, are preparing themselves for leadership. Not all readers become leaders, but all leaders must be readers." - Harry S Truman I...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need book sets for Guided Reading lessons.
proposals.synopsis: "Readers of good books, particularly books of biography and history, are preparing themselves for leadership. Not all readers become leaders, but all leaders must be readers." - Harry S Truman <br/><br/>I teach students Kindergarten - Sixth Grade in a self-contained and resource setting in a rural school in Arkansas. All of my students come from high poverty situations and are on free or reduced lunches. The greatest struggle for many of my students can be found in reading. Although I teach up to the Sixth Grade, most of my students read on a First Grade level. However, this doesn't stifle the drive that my students have to learn. <br/><br/>We are in desperate need of guided reading book sets. Guided reading is an instructional approach that involves the teacher working with very small groups of students that function on a similar reading level. These texts offer challenges and opportunities for children to think critically. The ultimate goal of guided reading is to move students closer to independent reading. Right now we have very limited access to resources such as book sets. By having these book sets in our classroom, we will be able to devote more time to becoming better readers. <br/><br/>Most, if not all, of my students are at least two grade levels behind in independent reading ability. With constant access to guided reading book sets, my students will be able to work to bridge their gaps faster.  As a result, they will become more college and career ready.

proposals.title: Tactful-ly Yours!
proposals.shortDescription: Imagine trying to learn without wearing your glasses! Many of my students have vision problems which cannot be helped through corrective lenses. They require enlarged print, highlighted text,...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need multi-sensory materials such as a triangular pencils, Wikki Stix, highlighter tape, read along classics with CD, social studies readers, and a magnetic easel to learn functional reading and math skills.  These materials will allow me to adapt academics, making them much more meaningful!
proposals.synopsis:
Imagine trying to learn without wearing your glasses!  Many of my students have vision problems which cannot be helped through corrective lenses.  They require enlarged print, highlighted text, audio and verbal accompaniment to text materials, and tactile additions. <br/><br/>Our school is located in the inner city limits serving about 160 students with multiple disabilities. Our students, ages three to twenty-one years, suffer from severe and complicated physical and cognitive disabilities. Serving children beginning at a young age enables teachers, paraprofessionals and therapists to maximize the potential within each child. After completing their education at the Baer School, young adults may go on to an adult day care environment or to a special education high school in the area.  Some students go on to hold a job in a sheltered work environment. 
Our school has been around for over 70 years and is a staple in the special education community. School budgets are tighter than ever, so we depend greatly on the generosity of our community neighbors to help meet the needs of our special students. Our students have unique needs that cannot be met by traditional school and district funding. <br/><br/>These materials will be used for all activities during our Styer-Fitzgerald curriculum work and leisure stations within the classroom.  Students will use Magnetic Scheduling Clocks along with their object/tactile schedule icons to be introduced to time concepts.  Each clock will represent the time an activity is set to start. 
 
Other materials provide tactile and/or visual cues for students.  Triangular pencils are easier to grasp.  Large, three-dimensional numbers allow tactile exploration, providing more cues to the learner.  Wikki Stix are used to enhance locations on our programmable computer keyboard.  The social studies readers are modified and present bold photographs with simplified language in the text.  Functional community activities, similar to those we participate in each week, are the highlight of the readers.  The other materials requested will add extra visual highlights to our students' work. <br/><br/>Meeting the needs of each, individual student means modifying all classroom and learning materials.  Each of my students presents with different strengths and needs, yet all benefit from multi-sensorial learning.  Students will "write" shopping lists, identify cost of items, sort vocabulary items by category/group, and enhance literacy skills by listening while viewing the text.  We will also learn community skills which prepares them for the future.

proposals.title: It's Not All Black and White
proposals.shortDescription: My students work hard and although many struggle, they are determined to succeed. Imagine having expectations from the city and state but without having the resources and tools to make them a...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need iPad minis and protective devices to ensure they will last a lifetime.
proposals.synopsis:
My students work hard and although many struggle, they are determined to succeed.  Imagine having expectations from the city and state but without having the resources and tools to make them a reality? Ipads needed! <br/><br/>My students live in an urban, overpopulated school.  They have limited tools and resources available to access technology readily.  Students have very little experience using technology and many do not have access to the internet, apps, or even computers at home.  Ipads will provide students with all this and more!  In the classroom, it is my mission to use the iPads in a research based manner.  

Many of my students speak a language other than English at home and many of students have learning disabilities that make the traditional classroom a difficult learning environment and require a more hands-on approach. Despite the challenges that they face, the students in my school are consistently eager to learn and enthusiastic about new and exciting learning opportunities. <br/><br/>My students respond very well to technology in the classroom, and when implemented appropriately and specifically to their needs it provides students will a wealth of knowledge and ability to check their work with the use of "a robot" so they are constantly self-checking themselves and accountable for their work.   Students are expected to conduct research using technology.  Providing books, simply isn't enough anymore, and relying on students' to conduct this research at home or in the library limits the majority of your class from being successful because they do not have these resources or means to access technology.  By providing the majority of my students with an iPad, students will either be researching independently or collaborating with the teacher.  This allows for successful research projects by providing unlimited resources for students and additional avenues for them to present their project. <br/><br/>Help make a difference in the lives of students who are so deserving of the tools that are necessary for them to be successful in our ever-growing technological world.  Impact students' ability to become knowledgable of tools that are helpful in their everyday lives.   Give students not only this opportunity, but exposure to technology they would otherwise not be familiar with. Your generosity will not go unnoticed (no matter how big or small your efforts may be). Help make a difference!

proposals.title: Technology to Enhance Our Experiences
proposals.shortDescription: I am lucky to have twenty two eager students who have a passion to learn. They are a very active group that are soaking up all the skills and information that I can present them with. They are...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an iPad mini to improve literacy during our independent language arts block.
proposals.synopsis:
I am lucky to have twenty two eager students who have a passion to learn.  They are a very active group that are soaking up all the skills and information that I can present them with.  They are also intrigued our ever expanding  technical world. <br/><br/> Our school is located in a small rural community in Michigan. Many of our current students come to us with limited experiences and economical resources. We rely on our wonderful and supportive community to donate supplies, their time and bring experiences to our students.  For example, instead of fall field-trips we have local organizations bring their expertise to our students.
Our first grade classroom of 22 students is all eager to learn. Eighty percent of our class qualifies for free or reduced lunch. Because of the limited income of our students' families, many of them have limited life experiences. The students are highly engaged in technology and are motivated to learn when using computers.  However, they have a hard time waiting for our turn to use the computer lab.  In addition, approximately only 30% of them have access to the technology needed to expand their experiences at home. 
 <br/><br/> Teaching with an Apple iPad mini will help me to enhance my instruction and help bring experiences into the classroom to help build students knowledge.  I will utilize the technology training I recently received during a professional development seminar.
Daily use of an Apple iPad mini in the classroom will give students experiences with writing and reading blogs with others.  They will gather and share content across the curriculum.  We can turn our whiteboard into a board where we can record our voice and publish it on the web. This is just a small list of the possibilities.  We can't wait to get started!
 <br/><br/>Technology is the key to the future.  All donations to our project will help to give my students an unlimited amount of experiences with 21st  century skills that will be needed to be successful in their future educational experiences.

proposals.title: Connect a Kid with a Kindle
proposals.shortDescription: "The knowledge that a good book awaits one at the end of a day, makes that a better day." -Unknown<br /><br />Every school day ends with time for SSR. I want all of my students to feel the joy of twenty...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need two Kindles as additional resources to engage in the important work of SSR.
proposals.synopsis:
"The knowledge that a good book awaits one at the end of a day, makes that a better day." -Unknown

Every school day ends with time for SSR. I want all of my students to feel the joy of twenty minutes of being enveloped in their own little world of reading. <br/><br/>My eighth grade students are wonderfully diverse and high need. Each of my three classes includes Special Education students, English Language Learners, and striving readers and writers.  Our Kindergarten through 8th grade urban school has a 99% poverty rate. We serve over 600 students, many who have educational and social needs. Despite all of this, our kids come to school everyday ready and willing to learn. <br/><br/>Each day, twenty minutes is devoted to self-selected reading. Many of my most reluctant readers will do anything to avoid reading during this time. I fully anticipate and expect that the use of carefully selected eBooks via the Kindles will allow these children to access a new world of reading, one in which they can feel successful and lose themselves in the joy of reading. <br/><br/>The ability to read is fundamental to one's success in life. I want and need for each of my students to be reading at grade level. The Kindles will be an additional resource to use to reach all of my students.

proposals.title: Color our Data with a Color Printer!
proposals.shortDescription: The statistics say approximately half of my students will graduate high school. In my classroom we work hard to combat this stat. "Intelligence is not fixed. Hard work increases intelligence." My...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a color printer and ink to bring our scientific data to life.
proposals.synopsis:
The statistics say approximately half of my students will graduate high school. In my classroom we work hard to combat this stat. "Intelligence is not fixed. Hard work increases intelligence." My students apply this everyday in my classroom and dream big even when the statistics are not on our side. <br/><br/>I work in a very under-resourced school district in California. Despite the extra challenges my students face on a daily basis, each comes in with a desire to learn. The classroom is a place where they can be successful and I'd love your help in being able to provide them with all the items they need in order to be successful in the classroom. 

Students want to learn Biology, but the traditional method of worksheets and notes no longer work. We must continue to revamp our offerings and allow students to learn on their terms through better technological tools. A lack of resources should not be an extra challenge that these students need to face. Our school is determined to fulfill the potential of kids who deserve a quality education. <br/><br/>My students need a color laser printer. A color laser printer will allow students to be more creative in their development of laboratory reports with enhanced visuals and dynamic looking graphs, charts, and more. Students will also be able to better use colorful resources as reference tools as the teacher can present and give students more colorful visuals to help in their understanding of Biology concepts. <br/><br/>Color makes such a difference in this world and so can you! No color printers are available to students in the school only black and white. The use of a color laser printer will give students the ability to print better and more colorful visuals and develop projects with a more creative and eye catching view. This printer will open up so many new ways for my students to express themselves. Helping a child learn is priceless!

proposals.title: Cozy Classroom
proposals.shortDescription: Every day I begin the day with "Good Morning Friends," and they sign or say "Good Morning Teacher." I would like my students to become more responsible for their own actions and what they are...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a quiet area in the room to relax and read. They need headphones for the computers and radio. They also need a comfy chair to sit on in the quiet corner and a carpet.
proposals.synopsis:
Every day I begin the day with "Good Morning Friends," and they sign or say "Good Morning Teacher."  I would like my students to become more responsible for their own actions and what they are capable of doing on their own. "Nothing is impossible. The word itself says I'm possible" said Audrey Hepburn. <br/><br/>My students face many challenges on a daily basis. They all have an Intellectual Disability, which was formerly Mental Retardation. They all are living below the poverty  level, and many are sick due to their diagnosis. This does not stop them. They come in my class every day asking for work, and asking to help out in any way that they can. They know what is expected of them, and they accept responsibility for their actions. They do not notice that the school has little to no money. 
The school is located in an urban area. This school is also a Title I school. This means that "..this title is to ensure that all children have a fair, equal, and significant opportunity to obtain a high-quality education and reach, at a minimum, proficiency on challenging State academic achievement standards and state academic assessments." This school was also impacted tremendously by the recent budget crisis in the state of Pennsylvania. <br/><br/>I have requested a few things to make certain areas distraction free. The divider can be placed next to the computers so the others may focus on the teacher. I only have outlets on one side of the room, so I am very limited in the placement of computers and other electronics. 

The headphones can be used on the computers and on the radio to listen to books on tape. The headphones can drown out the noise that is around them so they can focus on the educational, curriculum enhancement Internet or computer games. 

The comfy chairs would be just that. I would like to make the reading corner more inviting. I have a few small pillows, but I need more so that they want to sit down and read a book or look through pictures. 

The carpet would be used to help block out more noise. The classroom is old and has titles on the floor. This makes it loud and very distracting. The carpet would help absorb some of the sounds and allow for more comfort. <br/><br/>This project will help make my class more inviting.  These students do not have much at home, so I would at least like to be able to provide it for them at school. School, for some of my students, is the safest and most inviting place they see every day of every week. These items would provide a warm and safe environment.

completedMatching.name: Disney
completedMatching.description:
Disney is amplifying the impact of teachers who rally support for their classroom projects. Any teacher who posts a new project has seven days to inspire friends and family to donate to their classrooms, and Disney will match that generosity. Details for teachers.

About Disney:
We believe that if you can dream it, you can do it. Our goal is to motivate generations of kids to harness the power of creativity to help improve their communities. The world's next great artists, innovators, athletes, engineers, architects, zoologists and dreamers are out there. Disney is thrilled to play a role in supporting teachers while providing kids with the tools they need to learn, thrive and create the future they imagine. By inspiring creativity in young people today, we hope to ignite the spark of innovation that will lead us all to a brighter tomorrow. Learn more about Disney's Citizenship efforts.

proposals.title: Super Students Need A Break: Part 2
proposals.shortDescription: My students are in desperate need of a cozy break spot in our room! We are on our way with a new carpet and bean bag chairs and with a little help from you, 2 room dividers will define this area...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 2 room dividers for our sensory break spot.
proposals.synopsis: My students are in desperate need of a cozy break spot in our room! We are on our way with a new carpet and bean bag chairs and with a little help from you, 2 room dividers will define this area and my students will have a spot to take a sensory break. <br/><br/>I am a first year special education teacher working in an inner city school district. My school is a Title I school with approximately 1,100 students in PK-8th grade. I teach eight students with Autism in a self-contained classroom, grades 4-7. My students have a wide range of abilities academically, socially, and in communication. I have three students who are nonverbal, communicating with pictures and/or speech generating devices. <br/><br/>All of my students have sensory impairments. They get over stimulated by noise and lights and get easily frustrated throughout the day. It is important for them to have a safe sensory spot in our room where they can take a sensory break. We currently have a spot where they can go and sit on a beanbag and use a sensory tool such as a pressure vest or weighted blanket and receive some much needed sensory input. Although we have the physical space, a new carpet and beanbag chairs, our spot is not clearly defined or private. Two room dividers will complete our break area. The spot will be clearly defined and it will also be a spot where the students can have a few private moments to take a break and become regulated and ready to return to classroom lessons. <br/><br/>Everyone benefits from a break at some point during their day. My students need these breaks more frequently than the average student. Won't you please help complete our break area with 2 classroom dividers and give my students a spot to take a much needed break?

proposals.title: Tick-Tock-Tick-Tock: Time Is of the Essence!
proposals.shortDescription: If you stepped into our classroom on any given day, you'd see a loud, busy mess of learning happening. We often become so engaged in learning activities that the time flies right by! We lose track...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need classroom timers in a variety of sizes to help them prepare for transitions between classes and maximize learning time.
proposals.synopsis: If you stepped into our classroom on any given day, you'd see a loud, busy mess of learning happening. We often become so engaged in learning activities that the time flies right by! We lose track of time, and before we know it the day has passed and we have not met our learning goals. <br/><br/>The eleven students in my classroom are hard working and excited to learn. They love coming to school each day, and enjoy the social and academic aspects of school. All of my students have cognitive and intellectual disabilities. Each child has unique learning challenges and specific needs to be met. They require unique support services, and with that comes unique joy and happiness in learning. My students feel proud and accomplished when they complete a new task, and it's my goal to give them more experiences that boost their confidence and build their stamina for learning. My students attend school in a big, urban district that leaves limited funding for special education programs. My students are often overlooked and their day to day needs are lost in such a big school system. We have so many varied needs in our classroom, it's nearly impossible for them to be funded by our school system. <br/><br/>Your donations will provide us with a variety of visual timers for our classroom. They will be used to maximize our time on task during the school day. My students and I get so engaged in learning tasks that at times, we completely forget to check the clock. Keeping on track is essential in order for us to learn about new, exciting, and essential topics! In whole group lessons, I will use the timer to keep track of my teaching, as well as time student-input sessions. During small group lessons, students and paraprofessionals will use the visual clocks to keep their group on task, so we can rotate through stations effectively. During independent time, students will use the visual timers to self-monitor the completion of their work. The variety of timers will not only be used to keep us on track as a whole group, but students will also learn valuable time management skills and begin to take ownership of their learning! <br/><br/>Staying on track is an essential component to teaching and learning. Your donation will be meeting a simple, day to day need in our classroom. Visual timers in a variety of sizes will help us stay on track during all times of our day!

proposals.title: Make Sitting in Class a Fun Activity!
proposals.shortDescription: Have you ever gotten tired of sitting in your chair at your desk? Although we do Kinesthetic activities in class to learn, we do spend a lot of time in our chairs and it is hard for some of my...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 2 exercise ball chairs to make sitting in class easier.
proposals.synopsis:
Have you ever gotten tired of sitting in your chair at your desk? Although we do Kinesthetic activities in class to learn, we do spend a lot of time in our chairs and it is hard for some of my students. <br/><br/>I am a teacher in a 6:1:1 classroom in a middle school for students with special needs. We have adopted the TEACCH method in our classroom. The students have a variety of learning methods which we emphasize in the class, through setting up different areas in the classroom. 

 <br/><br/>The chairs will be used in class as opposed to the hard metal chairs that we currently use. The students will recieve more comfort and less stress on their backs, which will hopefully lead to a more happy learning environment. I envision that just like the current chairs, these chairs can be used in all our classroom areas. <br/><br/>My students will have the oportunity to sit on the exercise ball chairs to help them with their sensory input. The castors will help us move the chairs without making loud noises or scratching the floor, which are also taxing on the students' senses.

proposals.title: Experiential Learning- Making an Icosahedron
proposals.shortDescription: My students are visual and kinesthetic learners that desperately desire to comprehend the math around them. When they learn through experience, they are at their sharpest. I strive to meet them...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need straws and multi-colored ribbons to create icosahedrons to visually comprehend geometric shapes and concepts.
proposals.synopsis:
My students are visual and kinesthetic learners that desperately desire to comprehend the math around them. When they learn through experience, they are at their sharpest. I strive to meet them where they are and get them where they need to be so they can succeed. <br/><br/>I teach in an urban school in Oklahoma in a special education math classroom. I  teach both 7th and 8th graders from all different ethnic backgrounds; however, the majority of my kids live in poverty.

My students are wonderful learners who struggle with conceptual math. However, once a math concept is made concrete through visual or kinesthetic means, my students shine. Throughout this school, I have consistently become more and more proud of my kids. At the start of the year, they were timid and afraid of getting incorrect answers. Now, they know and feel comfortable with trying again until they get the right answer- no matter how many times it takes. Now, they won't let me help them until they've tried the problems a few times on their own! My students have learned to be confident in themselves and work hard to understand every new concept i present them with. <br/><br/>My students will use the straws and ribbons to create icosahedrons, which are 3d figures with 20 faces formed most from equilateral triangles. We will take two days, one where we create the base of our figure and the second day where we put in all of the points of our star-like shape. 

This project is fitting in with our geometry unit, where we look at nets of 3d shapes, and calculate surface area and volume of 3d figures. This project will give my students practice in calculating the surface area of a complex 3d object, and help them understand that bigger, complex figures are made up of smaller, simpler figures. 

I am passionate about this project, because I know my kids are experiential learners, and giving them the chance to both create and analyze a product is so much better for them than me giving them worksheets or even having them analyze nets of shapes. Plus, at the end of the project, they have a product that they can be proud of. <br/><br/>Donations to this project would help further my kids understanding and internalizing the concepts of geometry. Beyond the long-term comprehension and a wonderful boost to help prepare for end of year testing, this is a very fun project that kids love and can proud of. Since project-based learning is more engaging, this also leaves students with a positive view on learning and makes them more excited to come into class the next day and learn more.
