Through its Ares In Motion program ("A.I.M."), Ares Management LLC has proudly partnered with DonorsChoose.org to fund projects focused on mathematics and financial literacy across the U.S. and to support educators devoted to making a difference in the lives of deserving students.

See all projects eligible for this match offer.

proposals.title: Finding the resources, they deserve and need...
proposals.shortDescription: I work in a new high school in Philadelphia. It has been a challenging year for us, due to a lack in our resources. The students I teach came from two neighborhood schools that were forced to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need just about everything.  We are a new high school and are starting from scratch.  We need paper, markers, rulers, glue sticks & books, to name a few...
proposals.synopsis: I work in a new high school in Philadelphia.  It has been a challenging year for us, due to a lack in our resources.  The students I teach came from two neighborhood schools that were forced to close last year.  It has been a difficult move for them but we are doing the best we can to make it work. <br/><br/>My students have always been told that they are not good enough, and so their schools last year were shut down.  We are still without textbooks in my class and many of my students have had to switch high schools more than three times.  This is sad to me, and all I want to do is to show them that when they try hard at something, good things will come their way.  My students are very spirited individuals and put forth effort when they feel that they can be successful.  I truly believe that if I can provide them with the resources that they need to do well, then they will rise up and come out on top.  I am asking that you support them in meeting this goal.  I have ordered a book for each one to create a journal of their likes and dislikes using the target language in my Spanish class for a grade, and then to keep forever.  Please be a part of doing something special and worthwhile for my students, so that they may know that just because they may not be rich, they are worth it & deserving. <br/><br/>My students will be so excited to receive the following materials; these items will truly enhance learning in my classroom each and every day. My students will love having a new box of colored pencils, glue sticks and markers to use when creating projects in class.  They will use the class set of rulers and erasers to keep their work neat and organized, and the mobile organizer to keep their classwork in, from one day to the next.  The journals that you give them will allow each the opportunity to create a book that they can treasure forever.  The Atlas books will be added to our classes' library after students use them to discover and extract information from for their country research projects and the apple timer will help to make transitioning from one topic to the next, a bit easier.  The paper collage kit is awesome and will encourage creativity.   I could never do this without you and I thank you for helping me to give my students what they really deserve and need to succeed. <br/><br/>You are giving my students so many amazing things and I truly appreciate your generosity. Your donations will make my classroom feel like a real room.  Right now it is missing many of the staples that a real room requires.  You will fill in the missing parts, and then my students will have everything that they need to do well.

matchingFund.name: AT&T Foundation
matchingFund.description:
You can bring this project to life at half the cost!

The AT&T Foundation will fund 50% of this project if someone like you provides the remainder. By completing this project, you will double the impact of your donation.

At AT&T we believe that investing in education is one of the most important things we can do for a strong future. It's an issue that's important to us, our customers and our country. The support for DonorsChoose.org is part of AT&T Aspire, the company's $350 million commitment to education. AT&T is funding projects at schools that need it most, with the goal of equipping students with the tools necessary to graduate high school and succeed in college, careers and life.

See all projects eligible for this match offer.

proposals.title: Supplies to Support Our New Technology!
proposals.shortDescription: My students were blessed with wondrous new technology this year, such as a Prometheus Interactive Whiteboard, and new Apple Macbook Air. Their use, however, is limited by what was missing from the...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a case, VGA adapter, CD drive and speakers to go with our new technology!
proposals.synopsis:
My students were blessed with wondrous new technology this year, such as a Prometheus Interactive Whiteboard, and new Apple Macbook Air.  Their use, however, is limited by what was missing from the boxes! Help us use our items to their fullest potential with the addition of these new tools! <br/><br/>My students are AMAZING. They are high schoolers empowered to do their best, but are limited by their intellectual, or multiple disabilities. My class is enrolled in a NYC Specialized School in a high poverty area of the South Bronx. They face cognitive, physical, and emotional challenges that many of us will never have to encounter, everyday. They are brave, resilient, eager to learn, and come to school with a positive attitude each and every day.

We have done a lot this year to ensure that the needs of my students are met by classroom tools. To foster engagement, an interactive whiteboard was installed; for deficits in handwriting, a new computer and speech-to-text software.  Now, after initiating the use of these new products, we're realizing needs are still not best met. <br/><br/>Without speakers, our interactive whiteboard limits volume produced by the interactive lessons I teach.  This often causes students to lose focus quickly, as they cannot appropriately attend to the listening tasks.  The addition of speakers will truly enhance the experience for my students and encourage greater participation and understanding of content.

When we received our new Macbook Air and Dragon Dictation software, we realized we had a problem! We couldn't install the software without a CD drive!  In addition to Dragon, our class has been provided with other software programs that truly enhance learning experiences for students with disabilities.  We cannot install these without the Apple USB Superdrive!

Wouldn't it be wonderful to use our new pieces of technology together?! Unfortunately, we cannot connect our new laptop to our new whiteboard without the Apple VGA Adapter!

Lastly, we need to ensure our new laptop is protected with a case as we seek to use it quite frequently! <br/><br/>Wouldn't you want the best education possible? These supplies will not only enhance the classroom environment, but increase attention span and foster the highest levels of engagement. With the necessary supplies to make our new technology work, we can really bring lessons to life for these students who require multiple means of representation to grasp concepts. Thank you so much in advance!

teacherFFPromoCodeFund.name: 100 Women
teacherFFPromoCodeFund.description: 100 Women in Hedge Funds is proud to support DonorsChoose.org in making a difference in the lives of teachers and students. 100WHF is a global, practitioner-driven non-profit organization serving over 12,000 alternative investment management investors and professionals through educational, professional leverage and philanthropic initiatives.

proposals.title: Connect Across Disciplines
proposals.shortDescription: Manipulatives are tools that let children think, perform, problem-solve, and make things happen while they are working toward a solution. It provides an important step in the evolution of children...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need books to help aide reading, flashcards for centers and drills, iPad cases to protect theirs for years to come, and a tie-up shoe for occupational skills.
proposals.synopsis: Manipulatives are tools that let children think, perform, problem-solve, and make things happen while they are working toward a solution. It provides an important step in the evolution of children developmental skills and learning values. <br/><br/>I have the pleasure of teaching an inclusion classroom that contains students with mild to severe special needs. Inclusion is an approach to educate students with special needs. Under the inclusion model, students with special needs spend most, or all of their time, with non-disabled students. My students come from a low income, usually one parent household with many siblings. However, they are the most loving and caring group of students. I look forward coming to work to be able to teach them and enhance their abilities so that in the future they are able to strive in today's society. Our school is one of three elementary schools in the district. It consists of pre-kindergarten through fifth grade classes. Each grade has anywhere from 100-120 students, all from the same socioeconomic background. The teachers travel from within the same city to up to 90 minutes away to work here. <br/><br/>We know that students need to be engaged to appreciate and learn what is being taught. My students need materials for both math and language arts. They need Write and Wipe Fact Family Boards, Subtraction Wrap-up Keys, and Minute Math Electronic Flash Cards. These materials will help master difficult math skills that need to be memorized and drilled. They need a Tie-Up Shoe to develop occupational skills. For our Language Arts curriculum, the students would benefit from Photo Language Cards for Rhymes, Opposites, Word Families, Blends and Digraphs. Students, especially ELL learners, are continuing to struggle with Reading. That is why I am also asking for a Book Set to help engage beginners to want to read especially when what they are reading is fun and interesting to them. We have recently added iPads to our classroom. Unfortunately, we need cases to protect them so that students in further years will be able to enjoy the creativity and hands-on learning experience. <br/><br/>Teachers who use a hands on activities see an increase in student engagement, knowledge retention, and learner independence. Teachers who see these results want to keep that spark alive in their students. That is why I want to afford my students new opportunities to learn in every way possible. Incorporating hands-on learning into every classroom lesson helps students grasp and retain concepts with greater ease. It also makes the entire teaching process most effective.

matchingFund.name: The Community Foundation of New Jersey
matchingFund.description:
You can bring this project to life for less than $100!

Thanks to funding from the Community Foundation of New Jersey, this project is "Almost Home!" The Community Foundation of New Jersey will fund most of this project if someone like you provides the remainder. By completing this project you will leverage the impact of your donation.

See all projects eligible for this Double Your Impact offer.

Established in 1979, the Community Foundation of New Jersey is an alliance of families, businesses and foundations that work together to create lasting differences in people's lives and communities. Our mission is to support charitable giving that is inspired by our donors, targeted at making our communities stronger, driven by creative solutions, and effective in achieving lasting change. We have a network of affiliates in Newark, Mercer, Monmouth and Morris Counties, and in South Jersey. Through a combination of Legacy Funds and Donor Advised Funds, the foundation has granted an average of more than $25 million each year to charitable organizations and currently stewards over $250 million in charitable assets for current needs and future challenges.

proposals.title: APPetizing Learning Choices
proposals.shortDescription: Imagine walking into a first grade classroom of 24 eager, energetic, ready to learn boys and girls all with different interests, experiences, and levels of learning. The problem is that their...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need one iPad and a variety of nonfiction and leveled books to choose from to improve literacy, writing skills, and individual social and learning goals.
proposals.synopsis: Imagine walking into a first grade classroom of 24 eager, energetic, ready to learn boys and girls all with different interests, experiences, and levels of learning.  The problem is that their differences can't be met because their classroom lacks the materials and technology that they need. <br/><br/>Our school is located in a very rural, high poverty area, where students lack experiences needed to be successful with their learning goals. The use of individualized choice boards, nonfiction books, leveled books, and small group instruction will help keep them motivated and meeting their goals.   I have come to the conclusion that in order for this group of kids to grow academically, I am going to have to individualized their instruction.  I am using small group and individualized instruction time to meet their needs.  During the time that I am working with these students, all of the other students will be busy completing their individualized learning plans using choice boards.  The boards will allow students to choose assignments from their appetizer, main course, and dessert menus.  These assignments will be strategically placed to meet their individual needs.  I plan on using the materials purchased with this grant to implement this type of differentiated instruction. <br/><br/>My first grade class has been a very challenging group.  It consists of twelve boys and twelve girls.  I also have a wide range of skill and interest levels.  My class is very active, but interested in learning.  I want to continue to keep them motivated in learning and meeting their learning goals this year.  Therefore, I want to implement small group and individualized instruction in my classroom.  The problem is that I lack the materials that I need to meet their needs.  I will be using choice boards to help differentiate instruction during this time.  This will allow me to help each student build an individualized plan for his/her learning.  The choices on this board will include the use of the nonfiction books and iPad included in this grant.  Students will be able to choose to use these materials individually or with small groups in order to meet their learning goals. <br/><br/>I found that this year's students are very interested in learning about animals.  We will use the nonfiction books to learn more about these animals.  We will also be completing animal research using these books as well.  The iPad will allow students to learn to use this new technology and provide many different digital learning experiences.

proposals.title: I Want to Increase My Students' Reading Fluency!
proposals.shortDescription: I want my students to be reading 1-2 years better than their current starting point of 4-5 years behind their grade level peers. I teach students with academic learning disabilities. They are in...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a comfortable place to listen to their paperback audio library to increase their current phonics skills.  They need the audio and books to hear good reading.
proposals.synopsis:
I want my students to be reading 1-2 years better than their current starting point of 4-5 years behind their grade level peers.  <br/><br/>I teach students with academic learning disabilities.  They are in grades 4-8th, in a multilevel classroom.  I have one and a half adults to help me accomplish their learning goals.  My students have great attendance and are learning to thrive in spite of their learning differences. They love working on anything computerized or audio typed.  They typically have better comprehension than their reading skills.  They work hard to build their background comprehension to improve their reading skills.  

My school has almost 700 students from Pre-K to Eighth grade.  We are 50% ELL and have a free and reduced lunch rate of 85% or higher.  My classroom is a Citywide Special Education Program for students who receive more than 60% of their day in my classroom.  We are located in Minneapolis, MN. 

My students are hands-on learners! They love to draw, make and act out what they learn.  They are active in our after school program and have a desire to be successful in the mainstream.  <br/><br/>I have tried to create a nice reading area in my classroom.  I will use the pillows for the students to sit on while reading independently or listening to the audiobooks (paperback library) provided by the newly implemented reading intervention program.  The students are progressing through the computer program at their own pace so all students are at different levels. My students will be able to have a choice of which book they listen to during independent reading time. 

The paperback library has an audio component that has been difficult for the students to access.  I currently have enough computers for each student to complete their daily instruction but not enough time for them to listen to the e-books component.  I have one CD player for the students (4-5 students at a time) to share during independent reading time.  Having another CD player with headphones will allow for two choices and different skill levels to be addressed.  <br/><br/>Receiving this donation will allow my students to increase their reading fluency, decoding and comprehension.  This donation will allow my students to improve their reading levels one to two grade levels.  

This donation will enable more opportunity for my students to hear good reading fluency, and improve their own reading fluency!

proposals.title: Creating Independence for Students with Special Needs
proposals.shortDescription: - I have an energetic, amazing group of students who have special needs.<br />-We complete centers/stations everyday to promote independence and one on one individualized instruction. I teach a 12:1:1...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need Hot Dots Pens and Quiz Cards, to reinforce literacy and math skills while promoting independence and self- correction.
proposals.synopsis:
- I have an energetic, amazing group of students who have special needs.
-We complete centers/stations everyday to promote independence and one on one individualized instruction. <br/><br/>I teach a 12:1:1 class for students with severe special needs (Autism, Intellectual Disabilities, Other Health Impairments, Multiple Disabilities). My class and school is extremely supportive of the students and creating an environment that is loving. We teach functional skills that promote independence wherever possible. 

My students want to be independent and with the use of centers, they can be. They have an individualized schedule which informs them where to be at what time. 

 <br/><br/>I am requesting different HOT DOTS materials; Comprehension, Vocabulary, and Math. HOT DOTS allows the students to be independent and self check their work with the use of an electric pen.

All three sets reinforce different reading, comprehension, and math skills that will be used at one of the center stations.  <br/><br/>These donations will allow my students to continue to work on skills that they need constant reinforcements on. It will also allow my students to build more Independence because the pen helps them self-correct. 

This will build skills for the future on how to self-correct and learn how to be as independent as possible.

proposals.title: Ipad for Applying for Jobs!
proposals.shortDescription: For me, applying for college and jobs was easy. I could go to school and use the Internet to finish my essays or research college programs from my local library. For my students, these luxuries I...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an iPad and protection plan to have the ability to apply for jobs, complete college applications, and access the internet.
proposals.synopsis:
For me, applying for college and jobs was easy. I could go to school and use the Internet to finish my essays or research college programs from my local library. For my students, these luxuries I took for granted as a teenager don't come as easy. <br/><br/>I teach 11th and 12th grade Career Exploration and Advocacy to a group of students with Emotional and Intellectual Disabilities at Ballou Senior High School. Our population of students is 99% free and reduced lunch and over 50% special education. 

For many of my students they have enormous goals for themselves but don't have access to the resources to achieve them.  In our classroom that serves over a 150 students regularly we have minimal access to the technology resources my students need in order to begin applying for jobs to gain experience to become productive members of society.

Over the past 5 months my students have made tremendous growth in learning about the professional and career skills they need to obtain to have a job after high school. Now they need to take the next step and apply for jobs so they can support themselves and their families after graduation. Without the necessary resources to do so this next step is becoming increasingly difficult. <br/><br/>My students will use the iPad in the classroom in a multitude of ways. Not only will they have a reliable place to come apply for jobs before and after school, but they will also have a secure mode of technology to manage their professional email accounts and documents for hiring. Most importantly, they will also gain the technology skills to be competitive in an ever changing work force.

In addition, an iPad will allow me to record assignments and lessons for some of my students are illiterate and provide them with a read aloud and type to text accommodations to fill out job applications and create resumes. <br/><br/>With the iPad in our classroom more students will be able to apply for jobs to boost careers that are realistic for them. They will also have the ability to contact employers and mentors about future opportunities in a place that is safe, unlike the local library and labs. Lastly, my students who otherwise aren't able to apply for jobs because they lack the academic skills to read and write will be able to use the read aloud and type to text tools to prepare for their future.

proposals.title: Little Fingers Breaking Barriers with Technology
proposals.shortDescription: Special needs students are just that SPECIAL and each one holds a special place in our hearts. We want to give each and every one of our students the opportunity to live up to their full...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need access to iPad technology they can manipulate with their hands. My students have fine and gross motor delays.  We have not technology they are able to access.
proposals.synopsis:
Special needs students are just that SPECIAL and each one holds a special place in our hearts. We want to give each and every one of our students the opportunity to live up to their full potential. This is very difficult to do this when they are physically unable to access technology in my room.   <br/><br/>My students are three to five years old with special needs. The students in our room have varying developmental disabilities. These children also come from a very low socioeconomic area. For most of these children coming to school is their safe haven. We strive to make a calm, comforting, and compassionate environment for them. We would also like to give them access to high quality educational experiences through technology. <br/><br/>Technology and computers are very important area in an early childhood classroom. This area is where children first experience learning though technology. Technology could ultimately be a form of communication for many of my students later in life. We currently have one out of date computer in our room. My students have major problems using this computer due to fine and gross motor delays. An ipad will allow my students to gain self-esteem and satisfaction from success.

 <br/><br/>Unfortunately, special education rooms are often the last to receive up-to-date technology in our county. Our classroom receives approximately two hundred dollars for our supplies yearly. That amount money doesn't even begin to cover the necessities, let alone buy replacements for broken or worn out items. Please help give our students the opportunity to explore and learn through technology. My students will not receive this opportunity for growth if not funded through Donorschoose.org.

proposals.title: Kinect-Sthetic Learning
proposals.shortDescription: We like to learn and find fun and exciting ways to learn! We don't just use our eyes, ears and hands, but our entire bodies! I am a teacher in a 6:1:1 classroom in a middle school for students...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an Xbox 360 with Kinect and games as well as a controller and charger so they can learn and exercise together in class!
proposals.synopsis: We like to learn and find fun and exciting ways to learn! We don't just use our eyes, ears and hands, but our entire bodies! <br/><br/>I am a teacher in a 6:1:1 classroom in a middle school for students with special needs. We have adopted the TEACCH method in our classroom. The students have a variety of learning methods which we emphasize in the class, through setting up different areas in the classroom. <br/><br/>My students just had a visitor who brought the Kinect in to show the children in my class, and they loved it! The students had so much fun and all interacted with it in their own way. We will set up various times during the week where the students can earn Kinect time to get the exercise they need as well as learn about personal space, sharing, and cooperation.   <br/><br/>How could this project not make a difference with my students? Just seeing the joy on their faces as they played and say their body movements translated into actions on the screen was proof enough that I needed to post this project. If you donate you will be making at least 6 students very happy, and possibly countless more!

proposals.title: Occupational Therapy for Autistic Support
proposals.shortDescription: My students are 2nd-4th Grade Autistic Support students in a title 1 school that has seen massive budget cuts. My students need these occupational therapy tools to help them in their daily tasks....
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need tools to help them in daily educational tasks. These items include communication cards, chewy's, slant boards, and body sox. These items promote success.
proposals.synopsis: My students are 2nd-4th Grade Autistic Support students in a title 1 school that has seen massive budget cuts. My students need these occupational therapy tools to help them in their daily tasks. Each item is used for a specific student's needs.  <br/><br/>My students are amazing children that come from dedicated families that do the best they can to support their children. My school is a Title 1 school in a district that has slashed every departments funding in an attempt to save the district. My children have suffered by not having the proper materials provided for them.  <br/><br/>The occupational therapy equipment such as body sox, communication tools, thereabout, Chew's and slant boards will help my students perform daily tasks. They will be able to focus on their educational learning more and make gains in their daily living skills to become successful adults.  <br/><br/>Your generous donations will be used to enhance the learning of my amazing students. With the right interventions, therapy's, and equipment we can enhance the lives and learning of my students to help them become independent members of society. Our goals are to give them the skills they need to grow and learn.

completedMatching.name: Disney
completedMatching.description:
Disney is amplifying the impact of teachers who rally support for their classroom projects. Any teacher who posts a new project has seven days to inspire friends and family to donate to their classrooms, and Disney will match that generosity. Details for teachers.

About Disney:
We believe that if you can dream it, you can do it. Our goal is to motivate generations of kids to harness the power of creativity to help improve their communities. The world's next great artists, innovators, athletes, engineers, architects, zoologists and dreamers are out there. Disney is thrilled to play a role in supporting teachers while providing kids with the tools they need to learn, thrive and create the future they imagine. By inspiring creativity in young people today, we hope to ignite the spark of innovation that will lead us all to a brighter tomorrow. Learn more about Disney's Citizenship efforts.

proposals.title: Fostering Independence
proposals.shortDescription: "Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them," said Albert Einstein, who also had a learning disability. My students are not accepting their limitations, instead they are replacing these feelings...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need Wizcom ReadingPens.
proposals.synopsis: "Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them," said Albert Einstein, who also had a learning disability.  My students are not accepting their limitations, instead they are replacing these feelings with confidence and independence. <br/><br/>My students attend a public school in Chicago where 92% of students are from low income families, qualifying for free or reduced lunch.  My students are students who struggle with reading independently.  Although they are very hard working, reading is difficult for most of them.  They are with me for part of the day and in the general education setting for the other part.  The general education teachers and I work closely together to do all we can to support these students and expose them to the grade level curriculum. <br/><br/>These Reading Pens will assist my students to become more independent when completing assignments, projects, and work.  My students will not have to rely on someone to read papers aloud when completing work that requires them to read something.  My students are very capable of making progress and being involved within the general education curriculum, they just need information read out loud to them.  With these Reading Pens my students will develop a sense of independence that they have not felt before.  The Reading Pen will also help my students improve their reading comprehension, vocabulary, and fluency. <br/><br/>Of course, these technologies cannot and will not replace direct instruction and interventions, but it will increase self-confidence and independence, when they are working in the general education setting.  My students love to listen to books read aloud to them and with new technology this is a possibility to do so independently.

proposals.title: Hot Dots Make Reading Rock!
proposals.shortDescription: My students are energetic and eager learners who love to read and strive everyday to achieve academic success. However, many are struggling with below level reading comprehension skills and are in...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need Hot Dots Reading Comprehension Quiz Cards - Complete Set and Hot Dots Power Pen set.
proposals.synopsis: My students are energetic and eager learners who love to read and strive everyday to achieve academic success.  However, many are struggling with below level reading comprehension skills and are in need of remedial and intervension learning tools that help them reach higher levels. <br/><br/>Our Title 1 school is located in Brooklyn's East New York and is considered High Poverty with all students qualifying for free lunch.  Budgets being what they are, electronic tools for academic programs are restricted or non-existent.  My General Education, ELL and Students with IEP's come from a variety of cultures and backgrounds.  But all are ready to take learning up to the next level and prepare for college. <br/><br/>I will use the Hot Dots to create skill-building learning centers that focus on phonics, grammary and comprehension.  Students will rotate between small group instruction with me to small group and/or individual time with the Hot Dot cards.  I will also use the Hot Dot system for student comprehension checks and assessments. <br/><br/>Your donations to my Hot Dots Make Reading Rock project will affect so many children for the better.  This tool will open up the world of reading and send my students on exciting academic adventures.  My goal is to hear my students say "Reading Rocks!"

proposals.title: Sensory Zone
proposals.shortDescription: My classroom is always on the go. My students are in kindergarten and first grade. They do not understand the concept of staying still to learn and love to have their hands on something. Our...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need sensory input throughout the day to focus on their work. The weighted turtle and hound, cuddle loop and cozy shades will help my students.
proposals.synopsis:
My classroom is always on the go. My students are in kindergarten and first grade. They do not understand the concept of staying still to learn and love to have their hands on something. <br/><br/>Our school is a Title One but you would never know by all our students learn. Everyone works very hard here and cares about the students' success. This is not my students' home school, they go to the school closest to their home school with my program. They all learn in just a little bit of a different way, but they do learn. <br/><br/>The students will use the weighted animals to help them to sit and work. They will also use the animals to carry around and provide them with some sensory input. The light covers will help my students when they complain it is too bright, it gives them light but not too much and will appear as more of a natural light.

Some of my students would benefit from a weighted vest or lap pad, but will not use them because they don't excite them. With the weighted animals the students would get the benefit of the supporting weight to sit longer for a reading lesson or during circle time. They would also be able to take it with them to assemblies to help them sit and participate with the rest of the school. <br/><br/>This project will help improve my students' ability to learn. My students have the will to learn and the ability, they just need some extra sensory materials to help them out. These materials could help my students sit that extra minute. If my students are able to sit longer they can receive more instruction from me as the teacher and then further their knowledge and understanding.

proposals.title: Art Supplies
proposals.shortDescription: Do you remember how much you liked art when you were a three year old?. I'm trying to turn my classroom into a partial art room, starting with basics such as color construction paper. Learning...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need paint, paper, rice, feathers and craft sticks.
proposals.synopsis:
Do you remember how much you liked art when you were a three year old?. I'm trying to turn my classroom into a partial art room, starting with basics such as color construction paper.  Learning through doing, is the best way to teach students at such a young age.  <br/><br/>I teach four special needs three-year-olds, and they have the most inspiring little faces you'll ever see. These student come from all over the county since they are special needs. One of the many benefits of teaching in Florida, is that our students are extremely diverse. They all come in with different types of life experiences. But as soon as they walk through the classroom door, they all need the same opportunities to develop artistic and math skills. 
 <br/><br/>I'm requesting various art supplies from Lakeshore such as paint, construction paper, feathers, colored pasta and 3-D foam shapes. I was shocked by the amount of academic work my three-year-olds were expected to comprehend. Art is one of very few remaining subjects that my students can still fully enjoy with no boundaries. I am requesting various art materials to help my student express themselves and make connections with the different math concepts. With the new art materials, I will be able to make learning more fun. At this age, students should be learning through play.  <br/><br/>The students are going to use the materials to make concrete connections to the concepts being taught. My students are very sensory-based and struggle with abstract thought. Being able to hold and manipulate material that relate to the concept, will help them understand what is being said.

proposals.title: Moving to Learn
proposals.shortDescription: My students are an active bunch. They like to move, dance, and wiggle. This movement helps them learn, but can also be very distracting and disruptive to the class. I would like to create an...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 4 Hokki Stools so they can move to learn. Hokki Stools will allow wiggly students to move around without disrupting other students during a lesson.
proposals.synopsis:
My students are an active bunch. They like to move, dance, and wiggle. This movement helps them learn, but can also be very distracting and disruptive to the class. I would like to create an environment where students can move and wiggle and not worry about bothering anyone else. <br/><br/>My students are kids who are excited to learn! They come to school each day hungry for knowledge and soak it up like little sponges. Our school is a Title I school, which means a high majority of the students receive free and reduced priced lunches. 

Some of these students do not have books or school supplies at home. I want them to be able to come to school knowing that even though they may not have these things at home, that they will have them at school. I also want to create an environment that allows my students to rich their learning potential. <br/><br/>Have you ever walked into a kindergarten classroom? If not, picture three or four students  who cannot stop moving, wiggling, and distracting their neighbors. Even if these students are separated, it disrupts the whole classroom. The teacher is constantly redirecting and trying to refocus the group. Teaching time is wasted. Children are not learning. 

I have requested four Hokki stools because students will be able to move safely (ie. not rocking on the legs of a chair) without disrupting the class. <br/><br/>Having stools that allow my students to be wiggly and move will be beneficial in my classroom because my students will be able to learn better. They will be able to move while learning and won't be distracted during lessons or a distraction to others.

proposals.title: A Soft Place To... Read!
proposals.shortDescription: My first graders are learning how to read. Each day, they spread out in the classroom to read some of their favorite books. They will try to use their coats as a cushion to sit on since the floor...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 6 Soft cushions and 4 Beanbag Seats to sit on while they are reading.
proposals.synopsis: My first graders are learning how to read. Each day, they spread out in the classroom to read some of their favorite books.  They will try to use their coats as a cushion to sit on since the floor is hard, cold tile. I encourage them to continue reading but they are often uncomfortable. <br/><br/>I teach in a school with a program that serves 100% free breakfast and lunch due to the poverty level in the community. My students do not have the support for reading at home so I do everything I can to foster a love of reading during the school day. They are emerging readers so it is important to get them excited when they are in first grade! They are beginning to have favorite books they love to read at school. <br/><br/>My students need 6 Soft cushions and 4 Beanbag Seats to sit on while they are reading. These resources will help my students be able to read more comfortably.  As adults, we read on couches or in bed.  When we are comfortable, we can focus on what we are reading.  Our students need to be able to think of reading as a pleasant experience rather than one where they are sitting on the hard, cold floor.  The bean bags and soft cushions will be used during the four literacy instruction blocks everyday.  By allowing them to be more comfortable, they will be able to reduce their distractions and practice reading.  This will also be a way to accommodate the learners who have special needs in my classroom.  The difference in the sensation of sitting on a cushion in a quiet space versus the floor will help those learners to be more successful. <br/><br/>This project will drastically improve the independent practice of the literacy skills my students are learning.  They currently have two options for seating: the floor or a chair. The bean bags and soft cushions in this project will provide a soft place for sixteen people to read at one time!

proposals.title: Critical Thinkers are Lifelong Learners
proposals.shortDescription: My students face many challenges in their daily school life. Language arts curriculum is becoming increasingly challenging for students with language delays. By improving critical thinking skills,...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need critical thinking photo prompts, games and skill books to improve their critical thinking and boost their reading comprehension.
proposals.synopsis: My students face many challenges in their daily school life. Language arts curriculum is becoming increasingly challenging for students with language delays. By improving critical thinking skills, my students can improve their comprehension skills. <br/><br/>I teach a class of 1st and 2nd graders with severe language and learning delays. These delays make critical thinking activities difficult. A program rich with visual materials makes these difficult topics easier to understand. In a inner city school, it is sometimes difficult to budget for these vital supplemental materials. My students can achieve at high levels, provided that they are taught in ways they can understand. Please help me provide the visual supports my class needs to be successful with critical thinking skills. A child who can think critically will become a lifelong learner. <br/><br/>The materials we are requesting will be used to create hands-on learning centers. By introducing critical thinking skills using photos, students are presented with real life situations and scenes from everyday life. This makes it easier for my students to discuss new concepts because they can relate to the pictures. By practicing critical thinking skills in game formats, we can eliminate the added stress of writing for students still developing their writing fluency. In this way, acquisition of the skills can be assessed independent from the student's ability to write about them. <br/><br/>One of the most important thinks we can teach a child with severe language delays is how to think critically, problem solve and express himself. By helping to provide my class with critical thinking materials, you will be helping children who struggle to express themselves to think and express themselves clearly.

proposals.title: All Those Math Words
proposals.shortDescription: Our school has semester block schedule, which means that we have 90 min of math daily for half a year. While, this enables students to get credits quickly, it also makes them have to process...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need Pre-Algebra word-wall-posters to help them recall previously learned math vocabulary. We also need some reproducable Geometry resources.
proposals.synopsis: Our school has semester block schedule, which means that we have 90 min of math daily for half a year. While, this enables students to get credits quickly, it also makes them have to process information more quickly, since we have to cover one year's worth of information in one semester. <br/><br/>I would describe my students as a very close knit group of teenagers. Even though they all seem to have different issues to deal with in life, such as being a teenage parent, coming from single parent households, being military family members and therefore have parents that are frequently away from home for as long as a year at a time, they seem to have strong friendships with each other, and look out for each other.  <br/><br/>With this project I am asking for math wall posters. Vocabulary is a big part of mathematics. Without having a complete understanding of the language of mathematics, it is unlikely that students will understand the questions on assessment. How is it possible to answer a question you don't understand? With these posters, vocabulary will also have a graphical representation, which will help visual learners. With the Geometry activity books, we will be able to take some of the boredom out of Geometry class. <br/><br/>Understanding the language of mathematics will help my students improve their test scores (to include state end of course tests) and it will improve their self-confidence in mathematics. Since mathematics is used in many professions, it will improve their outlook for future employment opportunities.

proposals.title: Take A Seat! Let's Meet! What A Treat!
proposals.shortDescription: Each day my class begins with a new and exciting adventure. The students come ready and prepared to learn each day. They have a great excitement for learning and enjoy sharing their passion with...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a table for working in small groups, a meeting place with a teacher and a place to work independently. They also need a writing caddy to hold supplies.
proposals.synopsis: Each day my class begins with a new and exciting adventure. The students come ready and prepared to learn each day. They have a great excitement for learning and enjoy sharing their passion with the other students. <br/><br/>My students are amazing third graders! They are energetic and full of life! They enjoy moving from one activity to another. When given a task, my students try their best to complete their work. They love to work hard and appreciate the help they receive. <br/><br/>I'm asking for a table to use in a separate part of the classroom. This will give a sense of privacy for those who are working in small groups. By being just a few feet away from the others in the classroom, the students will be able to focus better and concentrate on the tasks presented to them. This will also allow me to meet with students in a smaller group setting. We are also asking for a writing caddy to hold our writing supplies in one location.<br/><br/>Your donation will make a great difference in the lives of many children. This table will last for many years to come and will help build a classroom that fosters a warm and cozy environment. The students in my classroom will feel comfortable meeting with others comfortably and with a sense of privacy.

proposals.title: Magic Word Machines!
proposals.shortDescription: Remember the first book you were able to read on your own? You sounded out some of the words, but other words you knew by memory. We call these words "magic" words in my class because once you...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need digital voice recorders, headphones and batteries.
proposals.synopsis:
Remember the first book you were able to read on your own? You sounded out some of the words, but other words you knew by memory. We call these words "magic" words in my class because once you know them you magically begin to see them everywhere! We need your help to spread the magic in my class! <br/><br/>My kindergarten students are inquisitive, excited children. They love to come to school and learn new things every day. My classroom is an integrated co-teaching class where students with disabilities learn alongside students without disabilities. Many of the students in my class have disabilities related to speech, language and processing. 

My school is a small, rigorous elementary school that serves students from a variety of backgrounds. Because of recent budget cuts in my district, we have a limited budget for new technology and materials. <br/><br/>With the digital voice recorders, my students would be able to use technology to practice an individualized set of magic words independently. My students would be able to hear their magic words and would not need a teacher to read to them each time they practice. They would also be able to record themselves practicing their magic words, reading books, planning and narrating their writing. Not only would these tools help students learn their magic words, they would also help students to build their independence, fluency and stamina for independent writing and reading. <br/><br/>For our students, the multisensory learning experiences these materials would give us the opportunity to have in our classroom would enrich their lives immeasurably. By helping them build their foundational reading and writing skills, the digital voice recorders would be paving the way for future success in all academic areas.

teacherFFPromoCodeFund.name: 100 Women
teacherFFPromoCodeFund.description: 100 Women in Hedge Funds is proud to support DonorsChoose.org in making a difference in the lives of teachers and students. 100WHF is a global, practitioner-driven non-profit organization serving over 12,000 alternative investment management investors and professionals through educational, professional leverage and philanthropic initiatives.

proposals.title: Basic Needs for Autism Class
proposals.shortDescription: Repetition with variety: that is what my students with autism need. Variety is the key--doing the same thing over and over isn't fun for anyone, so we need to change it up! These materials will...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need daily practice with language arts and math concepts via computer games, workbooks, and homework practice, as well as light filters to help them focus.
proposals.synopsis:
Repetition with variety: that is what my students with autism need. Variety is the key--doing the same thing over and over isn't fun for anyone, so we need to change it up! These materials will allow me to present concepts in multiple engaging ways. <br/><br/>My students are readers, writers, mathematicians, dinosaur-lovers, car experts, Lego-builders, artists, experimenters, computer geniuses, and pretty smart cookies! They also all happen to have autism. Each one is unique and has his or her own special interests. 

My school has a high percentage of students living in poverty and dealing with additional challenges such as single-parent homes and language barriers. My students are no exception and live with these situations in addition to their autism. <br/><br/>Because we are a separate classroom, my students remain with me for multiple years. As a result, many materials can become overused and boring. I constantly need new ideas and new materials to keep their interest while also meeting their ever-changing needs, but the cost of doing that adds up very quickly.
These materials will provide daily practice with language arts and math concepts. I would like to have a SmartBoard center for students to practice with the CD games while other students work with staff members to complete daily journals. Carryover to the home can occur through the use of the school-to-home comprehension kit.
Finally, the light filters will help my students to better focus. The fluorescent lighting in the classroom is difficult for them to handle while working. <br/><br/>Your donation will help provide my students with engaging materials and new experiences. They are constantly learning and growing, and there's no telling how far we can go with the appropriate items in our classroom!

proposals.title: Let's Get Organized!
proposals.shortDescription: It is very important to teach children to be independent and organized at a young age. Organization and independence contribute to a child's academic success. Setting up the classroom where...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need cubbies and folders to keep their assignments organized.
proposals.synopsis:
It is very important to teach children to be independent and organized at a young age. Organization and independence contribute to a child's academic success. Setting up the classroom where students know where papers and supplies go will help us reach this goal. <br/><br/>My students are bright, lively, and eager 2nd and 3rd grade learners. They have a variety of special needs including Specific Learning Disabilities, Autism, Developmental Delays, and Speech and Language Impairments. They are always so energetic and enthusiastic about learning, despite the many challenges they may encounter in their daily lives.

Our school is located in the heart of South Los Angeles where the majority of students come from very low income households. Many of their homes lack essential educational resources as well as basic necessities for living. Our school has a diverse population with a large concentration of English Language Learners. <br/><br/>My students need cubbies. It is so important that they have a place to put their homework and assignments, especially one that is sturdy and easy for my students to use. With these cubbies, each student will have their own slot that will include any papers that need to be sent home such as announcements, graded papers, and homework. This will save my students time from scrambling through their desk and backpack to find their papers. My students also needs folders to organize their writing assignments. During writing time, we learned that writing is a process. It may take more than one draft to produce the final piece.  So, we need a folder to store all of our writing which includes the brainstorming piece, rough drafts, edits/revisions, and finally, the final draft. <br/><br/>I always want to provide the best learning experience for my students. I believe that an organized classroom will benefit my students as it will save us time and teach my students the importance of organizational skills. Your contribution to this project will not only make a difference in our classroom but it will make a lasting impact on my students' success by building lifelong skills in organization and independence.

proposals.title: Wiggle wiggle wiggle!
proposals.shortDescription: Learning is difficult enough for all students. My special needs children have the odds stacked against them! I'm constantly reevaluating ways to minimize distractions and make the concepts I'm...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need three wobble chairs.
proposals.synopsis: Learning is difficult enough for all students. My special needs children have the odds stacked against them! I'm constantly reevaluating ways to minimize distractions and make the concepts I'm teaching relevant to them in their unique lives. <br/><br/>I teach the kids that need extra help to succeed in their regular classroom. In addition, most of my students live below the poverty line. They aren't guaranteed food, love, and attention when they go home. School for most of them is the best place to be. In spite of their circumstances, they come to me ready to do their best! <br/><br/>The majority of my students have hyperactivity, attention, and/or sensory issues. I have heard research as well as talked to fellow teachers who have had tremendous success with Wobble Stools. The bottom part of the stool is rounded. The children will be able to have movement and sensory input while still staying in their defined space.   <br/><br/>Attention problems make my kids miss so much. If they can have that little bit of movement, it will help keep their brains active. Then they can listen to what I have to say, think more clearly, and ultimately be more successful!

proposals.title: Our iPad Needs Protection!
proposals.shortDescription: Speech-language therapy happens all over our school building! My students are hard-working students who come from low, socio-economic homes. Many don't have the opportunity to use technology at...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an iPad case to protect our iPad and headphones so we can make better use of our iPad in the classroom.
proposals.synopsis: Speech-language therapy happens all over our school building! <br/><br/>My students are hard-working students who come from low, socio-economic homes.  Many don't have the opportunity to use technology at home, and try to take advantage of every opportunity at school to use a tablet or laptop computer.  They each have such big hopes and dreams they are pursuing!   <br/><br/>Speech and language therapy happens in all parts of our school building - many times in the hallway or in the back of different classrooms.  We would love to have an iPad case and headphones to use with our iPad to help protect it, and be able to use it without bothering other classes and students.  Many of my students have difficulty reading and need the applications to read text to them so they are the most successful. That is difficult when we're in the hallway or working in classrooms because we interrupt others around us.  They'll be able to use the iPad to maximally benefit their own learning.   <br/><br/>This project will allow all my students to use the iPad.  I don't want to keep it from some students just because I'm fearful of it being broken when they touch (drop) it due to their own physical difficulties, but that is happening right now. These are students who would would benefit so much from the language and communication apps the iPad offers!  It will also allow us to use the iPad without interrupting other classes.  Thanks for your help!!

proposals.title: Play Your Way to Kindergarten!
proposals.shortDescription: Every child deserves every chance to be able to independently manage the items in the world around them. We need a little more to help to be able to manipulate the objects in our world. Our...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need materials to help with tactile exploration and small motor skills like a drill activity center, beads and puzzles which will allow for small motor play.
proposals.synopsis: Every child deserves every chance to be able to independently manage the items in the world around them. We need a little more to help to be able to manipulate the objects in our world. <br/><br/>Our students are wonderful! They are ages 3-5 years old with autism, developmental delays, down syndrome, cerebral palsy, speech impairments, and hearing impairments, as well as their typically developing peers. We also service some students that come from bilingual homes.  We use a combination of play and specialized therapies to encourage cognitive and motor development and meet the diverse needs of our classroom. <br/><br/>We are in need of materials to help with tactile exploration and small motor skills. The ability to control your motor movements in purposeful ways is important developmentally.  Varied materials will keep their interest high and as we all know, excited children "work" harder! We have requested a drill station where the students can match colors and "drill" to increase motor planning and cognitive skills.  We have requested bead pattern activities and puzzles for cognitive mapping skills and small motor skills.  We will use these activities during play to increase these skills lacking in so many of our students.   <br/><br/>The ability to maneuver objects independently is very important in the development of children. Our students need every opportunity we can give them to continue to try to work with their peers to develop those motor skills. Please help us.
